perturbation.original_text: This Consulting Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this 2nd day of January 2020, by and between Global Technologies, Ltd (hereinafter the "Company"), a Delaware corporation whose address is 501 1st Ave N., Suite 901, St. Petersburg, FL 33701 and Timothy Cabrera (hereinafter the "Consultant"), an individual whose address is 11718 SE Federal Hwy., Suite 372, Hobe Sound, FL 33455 (individually, a "Party"; collectively, the "Parties"). This Agreement is non-exclusive.
perturbation.changed_text: This Consulting Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this 2nd day of January 2020, by and between Global Technologies, Ltd (hereinafter the "Company"), a Delaware corporation whose address is 501 1st Ave N., Suite 901, St. Petersburg, FL 33701 and Timothy Cabrera (hereinafter the "Service Provider"), an individual whose address is 11718 SE Federal Hwy., Suite 372, Hobe Sound, FL 33455 (individually, a "Party"; collectively, the "Parties"). This Agreement is non-exclusive.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Consultant' to 'Service Provider' creates ambiguity as to whether they are the same entity throughout the document. This impacts obligations assigned to the 'Consultant' later in the agreement, making enforcement uncertain.

perturbation.original_text: CONSULTANT: GLOBAL TECHNOLOGIES, LTD By: By: Jimmy Wayne Anderson Timothy Cabrera Its: Chairman and CEO Its: Individual capacity Date: January 2, 2020 Dated: January 2, 2020
perturbation.changed_text: SERVICE PROVIDER: GLOBAL TECHNOLOGIES, LTD By: By: Jimmy Wayne Anderson Timothy Cabrera Its: Chairman and CEO Its: Individual capacity Date: January 2, 2020 Dated: January 2, 2020
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Consultant' to 'Service Provider' makes it ambiguous as to what is going on with the contract. Who is the service provider? Did the agreement change names and should the whole text change? This impacts obligations assigned to the 'Consultant' or 'Service Provider' later in the agreement, making enforcement uncertain.

perturbation.original_text: 5. COMPENSATION TO CONSULTANT. As Consultant's entire compensation for its performance under this agreement, the Company shall pay Consultant $250,000,00 cash compensation. In addition, the Consultant shall earn additional cash compensation for the sale of any inventory/assets that were acquired in the acquisition of TCBM Holdings, LLC on November 30, 2019. Any cash compensation paid to Consultant shall be treated as a reduction in principal to the Convertible Note ("Note") issued by the Company to Jetco Holdings, LLC ("Jetco") on November 30, 2019.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. COMPENSATION TO SERVICE PROVIDER. As Consultant's entire compensation for its performance under this agreement, the Company shall pay Agent $250,000,00 cash compensation. In addition, the Service Provider shall earn additional cash compensation for the sale of any inventory/assets that were acquired in the acquisition of TCBM Holdings, LLC on November 30, 2019. Any cash compensation paid to consultant shall be treated as a reduction in principal to the Convertible Note ("Note") issued by the Company to Jetco Holdings, LLC ("Jetco") on November 30, 2019.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Consultant' to 'Agent' in the first sentence, then to 'Service Provider' and back to 'consultant' causes confusion. It's unclear which entity receives the initial compensation, creating doubt about financial responsibilities and potentially leading to disputes.
